title: Secondary School Students Manage Virtual Banks in Bulgaria's Fourth Annual Banks in Action Competition
summary: Sofia, Bulgaria – More than 60 students from all over Bulgaria took part in the fourth national "Banks in Action" student competition, which was held in Arena Di Serdica Hotel in Sofia. Twenty teams from 15 schools from 10 Bulgarian towns competed against each other in the national finals of the program.
tag-1: Secondary School Students Manage Virtual Banks in Bulgaria's Fourth Annual Banks in Action Competition
tag-2: Sofia, Bulgaria – More than 60 students from all over Bulgaria took part in the fourth national "Banks in Action" student competition, which was held in Arena Di Serdica Hotel in Sofia. Twenty teams from 15 schools from 10 Bulgarian towns competed against each other in the national finals of the program.
tag-3: Banks in Action is a financial education program run by Junior Achievement Bulgaria and funded by Citi Bulgaria, through Citi Foundation grants. The program culminates in a national competition, which was included in the 2010-11 calendar of extracurricular activities of the Bulgarian Ministry of Education. This year, the students from the National Trade High School in Plovdiv grabbed the top prize of "Best Student Bank."
tag-4: During the competition, with the aid of a computer simulation, the students play the roles of CEOs and product specialists who need to make management decisions as they operate their banks in a challenging and dynamic environment. The young managers are split into teams and are required to work together to determine interest rates on loans and deposits, investment strategies, marketing budgets in order to best position their banks on the market. Throughout the competition, Citi volunteers provide assistance and consultancy services to the young bankers.
tag-5: At the end of the competition, the bank with the highest Bank Performance Index walked away with the prize of "Best Student Bank." Awards were given to the first and second runners-up, as well as the teams that had the "Best Strategy" and "Best Recovery. Individual certificates were given to all participants.
tag-6: "The computer simulation provides an opportunity to test yourself and compete against the best students in the country," said Boryana Haidarova, a member of the winning team. "Banks in Action bridges the gap between theory and practice and not only helps us understand how banks work, but allows us to test our knowledge and skills in a 'real situation.''"
tag-7: Banks in Action is an interactive financial education program helping high school students acquire knowledge and skills in banking and finance. They also learn key concepts, acquire money management skills that can help them handle future financial challenges. The program also helps young people make an informed decision on the choice of careers in the financial sector. Banks in Action was launched in Bulgaria in 2005 and has reached over 6,000 students. In 2008 an online version of the competition was introduced and finalists get the chance to compete not only in the National Competition but also qualify for the finals of the European Banks in Action Competition held in Brussels every year. The team from the Varna Trade and Finance High School that represented Bulgaria placed second at last year's European championship.
